alert.note: Alert for Ellis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 07 at 6:38PM CST until further notice by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by localized excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central Texas and southeastern North Texas, including the following counties, in central Texas, Henderson, Hill, Limestone and McLennan. In north central Texas, Ellis, Kaufman and Navarro. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor-drainage areas. Ponding of water on roadways is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated pockets of moderate to heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms training over the same areas. Isolated instances of 1 to 2 inches are possible. With cold and more impervious soils, Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waco, Corsicana, Ennis, Hewitt, Robinson, Bellmead, Woodway, Lacy-Lakeview, Gun Barrel City, McGregor, West, Tool, Beverly Hills, Lorena, Kerens, Seven Points, Hubbard, Moody, Coolidge and Trinidad.
